UserAccount.title: UserAccount
UserAccount.description: Represents a user account within the AnimEcom application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

definition.description: Stores user account information. Path-based ownership ensures only the authenticated user can access their own data.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user, matching the Firebase Auth UID.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC, and QAPs. User accounts are stored under `/users/{userId}`. This path-based ownership ensures that only the authenticated user can access their own data. The `id` field within the UserAccount document is redundant given the path structure and could be omitted for simplicity. The orderIds array stores references to order documents. Orders could be stored as a subcollection of UserAccount (`/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}`), or in a top-level `orders` collection, depending on whether orders need to be accessed independently of user accounts. If stored in a top-level `orders` collection, the UserAccount data would need to be denormalized with the `userId` to allow secure listing of orders by user.
